name: Hoda Eldardiry
content: Hoda Eldardiry | Hoda Eldardiry at Virginia Tech Jump to: Navigation Dr. Hoda Eldardiry is Associate Professor at Virginia Tech Computer Science and director of the Machine Learning Laboratory. Eldardiry’s research is in robust machine learning for information extraction, forecasting, and control. Prior to joining Virginia Tech, Hoda led the machine learning research group at Xerox PARC. She obtained her doctoral degree from Purdue University Computer Science, where she also received the Early Career Distinguished Scientist Award.Eldardiry authored 85+ publications in reputable AI/ML venues including JMLR, TKDD, TIST, TBD, TKDE, AAAI, KDD, WWW, CIKM, BigData, ICONIP, PAKDD, IJCNN, EMNLP, and COLING. Hoda has served on advisory/editorial/review boards including NSF, MIT Press, TITS, AAAI, BigData, NeurIPS, DMKD, KAIS, ICML, KDD, WSDM, SDM, and technology startups. Her research is supported by total grant funding of $27,424,460 ($13,808,328 share) from VT, IARPA, DOE, NSF, DARPA, NIH-iTHRIV, CCI, EBAY, SIEMENS, ADOBE, P&G and XEROX.2024 GrantsNSFAdvancing Health Equity using Interactive Condition Assessment and MonitoringVT PI [Total $997,763], [Share $299,986]NSFExploring How AI Engineers Perceive and Develop Translational Ethical CompetencyPI [$349,360]EBAYHeterogeneous Hypergraph Modeling for Zero-Shot Product Aspect IdentificationPI [$100,000]IARPASize-Segregated Particle Odor Chromatographic KernelCo-PI [Total $8,957,534], [Share $870,087]All grants2024 PatentsMethod and System for Similarity-based Multilabel Learning H.
